availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Bond (Essex County, New Jersey, real estate agent and Kentucky Commissioner of Deeds)

body.p: Essex County, New Jersey, real estate agent and Kentucky Commissioner of Deeds. New Jersey Native. Married Caroline C. Smith Bond in Essex County, New Jersey, on February 19, 1834. Father to Henrietta Bond, Mary E. Bond, and John B. Bond. State Assemblyman from Essex County from 1859 to 1860. Real estate agent in Essex County in 1860. Employed Mary Tighe in Essex County as a servant in 1860. Commissioner of Deeds of Kentucky in Essex County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark Ward 5, p. 433B.

"Monmouth Democrat 1860-01-12," newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/image/497422868 (accessed May 7, 2021).
New Jersey, U.S., Wills and Probate Records, 1739-1991, Applications for probate of wills, vol. 2-3, 1881-1886, Essex County Surrogate Court, p. 257 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
KYR-0001-031-0016.
